name: Andre Murbach Maidl
title: Keynote: How We Built ClickStack - an open source, open telemetry native Observability stack
abstract: Observability was broken. How we built ClickStack - an open source, open telemetry native Observability stack.
bio: Andre Murbach Maidl is a Curriculum Developer at ClickHouse with over 20 years of experience, which includes software development, services administration, and systems support. Based in Curitiba, Brazil, he has held roles at Conectiva Linux, HSBC GLT, and Elastic, specializing in observability and technical education.

name: Rod Anami
title: Building observable VLM platforms at Kubernetes, PyTorch, OTel, and Grafana
abstract:
How can Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) effectively develop a robust Vision Language Model (VLM) platform leveraging Kubernetes, OTel, PyTorch, and Grafana? This approach enhances scalability and efficiency, empowering teams to innovate rapidly in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) while maintaining the observability and reliability of systems.  

Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) have been working with AI for over a decade, utilizing AIOps tools to make sense of large amounts of observability data, thereby becoming familiar with AI/ML. As a result, they are a natural choice to tackle VLM platform hurdles.  

This session pours Site Reliability Engineering principles, patterns, and practices into AI/ML platforms using the ModelOps operating model to propose a few ideas for the following questions:

- How do SREs insert SLIs and SLOs for VLM-powered applications through the ModelOps pipeline?  
- What is observability for the new AI world?  
- How do SREs identify and eliminate toil in such environments by streamlining AI experiments?  

**Benefits to the ecosystem**  

- Share practices and patterns on how SREs insert SLIs and SLOs for AI/ML models and their serving app through the ModelOps pipelines  
- Explain the concept of observability in the new AI world  
- Learn how SREs identify and eliminate toil in such environments by streamlining AI experiments at the Edge  
- Understand how SREs can be the missing piece in the AI arena for a more efficient AI/ML platform that aligns with responsible AI policies
bio: [Rod Anami](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rodanami/) is a seasoned engineer who works with cloud infrastructure and software engineering technologies. As one of the Site Reliability Engineers from the SRE@Kyndryl CoE, he coaches other SREs on running IT modernization, transformation, and automation projects for clients worldwide. Rod leads the global SRE guild inside Kyndryl, where he helps plant and grow SRE chapters in many countries. Rod is certified as an SRE, Technical Specialist, and DevOps Engineer professional at their ultimate levels. He holds AWS, HashiCorp, Azure, and Kubernetes certificates, among others. He is passionate about contributing to the open-source software at large with Node.js libraries. Rod is also author of the "Becoming a Rockstar SRE" book.

name: Danne Aguiar
title: Business Observabilty with Dynatrace
abstract: Observabilty is well known for IT departments around the world. SRE relies over Observability data to ensure the systems are performing as it should be. Automations depends on Observability insights to accurately remediate events. What about bring the Observability to Business side of history? Application Performance Monitoring (APM) tools capture more than the only 4 Golden Signals, let's leverage this and provide insights to the Business. In this presentation, I will explain how the Business Events can be captured from monitored sytems, and how to handle them in order to be presented and monitored, providing a real time source of insights at Business level.
bio: I am currently working as Observability Consultant @ Kyndryl. IT Monitoring specialist since 2009. Started to play with APM tools in 2017 and presented to SRE world in 2020. I have participated in two sessions of ["The State of SRE by Dynatrace" (2022 and 2023)](https://info.dynatrace.com/noram-all-wc-the-state-of-sre-in-2022-19382-registration.html https://info.dynatrace.com/noram-all-wc-the-state-of-sre-in-2023-22177-registration.html)

name: Tiago Dias Generoso
title: Observability Strategy: From Metrics to Meaningful Reliability
abstract:
Observability isn‚Äôt about tools‚Äîit‚Äôs about strategy, people, and culture. Too often, organizations invest in ‚Äúmagic tools‚Äù expecting instant results, only to end up with dashboards no one uses, alerts no one trusts, and teams that feel more burdened than empowered. True observability must start with strategy: aligning telemetry with business outcomes, defining maturity models, and using benchmarks to guide the journey.

This talk advocates for a shift in mindset: observability as the compass, not the destination. We‚Äôll explore how maturity models and benchmarking frameworks can help organizations measure progress, identify gaps, and link engineering practices (like SLOs, automation, and postmortems) with business impact (resilience, reliability, customer trust). We‚Äôll also cover challenges often amplified in enterprise contexts‚Äîsuch as tool-centric procurement, talent gaps, silos between Dev/Ops/Business, and uneven maturity across teams‚Äîand discuss how SREs can drive cultural alignment to overcome them.
bio:
I‚Äôm Tiago Dias Generoso, an SRE Leader with 25+ years of experience in hybrid cloud transformation, observability, and reliability at scale. A Master Inventor with 15 patents and a board member at The Open Group, I combine hands-on technical expertise with strategic leadership to help enterprises align technology with business outcomes.

I hold certifications in SRE, Technical Specialist (OpenCTS L3), and Architecture (OpenCA L3), as well as multiple credentials from Azure, AWS, Dynatrace, and IBM.

I regularly publish on Medium, where I write about SRE, observability, architecture, Azure, and Terraform.

name: Joao Fernando Helena Filho & Gabriel Leite
photo: Joao Fernando Helena Filho & Gabriel Leite.png
title: Enhancing SRE with AI Agents on AWS: Intelligent Automation for Incident Response and Operations
abstract: Transform your SRE with AWS GenAI solutions. From automated troubleshooting with Amazon Q to intelligent agents via Bedrock, we help teams automate tasks, detect anomalies, and streamline operations. Enhance efficiency with AI-powered assistance.
bio:
**Jo√£o Fernando Helena Filho** is a Partner Management Solutions Architect at Amazon Web Services (AWS), where he helps partners design and implement cloud solutions that drive business impact. With more than 20 years of experience in IT architecture and transformation, he has led major migration and modernization projects across industries. Before joining AWS, Jo√£o spent 16 years at IBM as an IT Senior Specialist, focusing on infrastructure, virtualization, and cloud platforms. He‚Äôs passionate about understanding customer needs deeply and turning that insight into practical, scalable solutions.**

**Gabriel Leite** is a Solutions Architect for Partners at AWS. He has 18 years of experience in software development, critical systems, and solutions architecture. Currently, he supports AWS partners in building their journey to develop new competencies. An active member of the Serverless and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) community, Gabriel specializes in building business applications. His focus is on using the flexibility of Serverless services integrated with Generative AI to create high-value
 business solutions.

name: Douglas Bussoli Mugnos
title: Designing for Failure: Proven Techniques for Reliable Applications
abstract: Failures are not a possibility ‚Äî they are a certainty. What separates good systems from great ones is how they respond when things go wrong. In this talk, we‚Äôll explore resilience at the heart of SRE: proven techniques such as load shedding, sharding, and deployment strategies that transform outages into controlled, predictable events. Attendees will walk away with understanding of patterns to minimize failure impact, protect user experience, and strengthen the reliability of their applications. If you care about building systems that survive chaos, this is the session you can‚Äôt miss!
bio: Douglas Bussoli Mugnos is a Principal SRE with a proven track record in designing and operating highly resilient systems. He has trained over 12,000 engineers in SRE methodologies and +1,000 engineering in system design, and currently leads efforts to ensure product resilience, architecture design, deployment strategies, and observability at a multinational company. Passionate about transforming outages into predictable events, Douglas brings real-world insights to every talk he delivers.

name: Miguel Di Ciurcio Filho
title: Staging Is Dead: How Ephemeral Environments Redefine Platform Engineering
abstract: Static staging slows everything down. Ephemeral environments flip the model by creating production-like sandboxes for every branch. Learn how they accelerate feedback, cut friction, and boost reliability across your platform and teams.
bio:
I have a degree in Computer Science and a postgraduate degree in Networks from the Institute of Computing at UNICAMP. My professional journey has always been closely tied to innovation in IT infrastructure and automation. Even before concepts like DevOps, Infrastructure as Code, and Continuous Delivery became widely known, I was already adopting practices such as automated configuration management with Puppet and using Git for code versioning.

In 2011, I founded Instruct with my own resources, with the mission of transforming how companies operate their technology infrastructures. From the very beginning, I was directly involved in all areas of the company‚Äîdesigning projects, training professionals, negotiating with clients and partners, and helping to build a culture of technical excellence.

I was the first professional in Latin America to earn the Puppet Certified Professional certification, in 2012. Between 2015 and 2017, I spoke at PuppetConf in Portland, San Diego, and San Francisco, presenting Instruct‚Äôs success stories and experiences to an international audience. I also founded the Puppet Brazil Community and served as an official instructor for the Puppet Fundamentals, Practitioner, and Architect courses, training over 500 professionals throughout the years.

I have participated in various events such as TDC, DevOpsDays, and others, always speaking about automation, DevOps culture, and digital transformation. I‚Äôve had the opportunity to lead projects delivered with excellence for companies such as Equinix, Ita√∫, and C&A.

From 2014 to 2020, under my leadership, Instruct exclusively represented in Brazil several global DevOps technology companies, including GitLab, Sonatype, Puppet Inc, CloudBees, HashiCorp, Rancher, and Mattermost.

More than technology, I believe in building long-term partnerships, delivering real value to clients, and forming teams that share a common purpose and passion for what they do.

Dissatisfied with the current state of cloud-native application development, I decided to close Instruct and build a new platform to elevate how companies develop software to the next level.

And that‚Äôs how Cloud Programming Shell (CPS1) was created.

name: Ademar Gregio Junior
title: Driving FinOps with Reliability: How SREs Reduced Cloud Costs by 30% Without  Compromising SLAs
abstract: Our SRE team partnered with FinOps to automate real-time cloud optimizations in Kubernetes - resizing pods, rebalancing clusters, and adjusting machine shapes dynamically. This collaboration achieved over 30% cost reduction while maintaining SLAs, proving that reliability and financial efficiency.
bio:
SRE Manager at Accenture Brazil, working in the Financial Services practice. Passionate about observability, cloud reliability, and efficiency through automation. With a strong background in large-scale distributed systems, Ademar focuses on bridging technology, culture, and business outcomes - helping teams deliver resilient systems while

optimizing performance and cost.

name: Igor Eulalio Morgado Lopes
title: eBPF: Why is everyone talking about it and what does that mean to you?
abstract: In the rapidly evolving landscape of technology, a groundbreaking innovation has captured the attention of enthusiasts, developers, and industry pioneers. This presentation aims to demystify the buzz around eBPF, illustrating its potential in the realms of networking, security, and monitoring.
bio: Experienced Software Engineer with extensive knowledge of the Cloud and Container industry, speaker, and KCD Brasil 2024 Organizer.

name: Bruno Paiuca
title: The Anatomy of a Secure Request: Ten Layers of Defense from DNS to Database
abstract: Every HTTPS request tells a security story. Dissect the anatomy of an HTTPS request across ten layers of defense ‚Äî from DNSSEC, TLS, WAF,  to Cedar-based authorization and beyond. Learn how Devs, DevOps, and SREs can weave security-by-design into every hop of modern, cloud-native systems.
bio:
Bruno Paiuca is an SRE and founder of Opsteam, a consultancy specialized in mission-critical operations, SRE, and FinOps.

Husband of Nataly and proud dad of Aurora ‚Äî named after AWS Aurora, and also because he dreams of traveling with his family to see the Aurora Borealis.

Passionate about technology and people, he helps companies build resilient, efficient, and secure cloud systems that empower teams to innovate with confidence.

name: Gustavo Martins T Borges
title: Hello World in Production: Building Cloud-Native applications that survive the real world.
abstract: This talk you‚Äôll see how small, practical steps can make your application resilient, scalable, and ready for production without overengineering. Perfect for developers, SREs, and DevOps engineers who want to understand what production-ready really means in cloud environments.
bio: B.S. in Software Engineering with 14 years of experience in cloud infrastructure, observability, and production systems. I help companies design and operate reliable cloud environments, with a background in cloud migrations, cost optimization, and observability. 3x AWS certified, I have architected cloud-native solutions for clients ranging from startups to enterprises. Passionate about sharing knowledge, CNCF Community Group and DevOpsDays organizer in Goiania/GO.

name: Rodrigo Candido Leme
title: Supercharging SRE with Azure‚Äôs AI-Powered Age
abstract: AI transforms Site Reliability Engineering by automating incident detection, accelerating root cause analysis, and predicting outages before they happen‚Äîboosting uptime, reducing toil, and empowering SREs to focus on strategic improvements.
bio: With over 15 years of global experience in cloud architecture, infrastructure modernization, and AI application design, this speaker brings deep technical expertise and a sharp business lens to every engagement. Currently at Microsoft, he leads technical initiatives that accelerate digital transformation across industries, including retail, healthcare, telecom, and finance. A frequent presenter and IBM-recognized speaker, he has earned multiple Manager‚Äôs Choice Awards and GTS Labs Leadership honors for his contributions to innovation and technical excellence. He specializes in Azure, GitHub Copilot, hybrid cloud, and secure, scalable AI solutions‚Äîand believes every cloud journey should hit as hard as a Metallica riff.

name: Alexandre Melo Ferreira

bio: Observability Architect na Grafana Labs com experi√™ncia em SRE e Software Engineering, amante de gatos, mergulho e churrasco

bio:
**[Anderson Dorig√£o](https://www.linkedin.com/in/andersondorigao/)** is an IT Specialist (SRE) at Bradesco, leading the Cross Product SRE team and driving the adoption of reliability engineering practices across product squads. name: Alexandre Tavares
title: Diferencas entre DataOps e DevOps: Entendendo Pr√°ticas e Importancias na Era Digital
abstract:
Voc√™ est√° convidado para uma palestra imperd√≠vel que ir√° explorar as diferen√ßas e similaridades entre DataOps e DevOps, duas pr√°ticas essenciais no desenvolvimento moderno de software e na gest√£o de dados.

A defini√ß√£o e os objetivos de DevOps e DataOps. As principais diferen√ßas entre as duas pr√°ticas e como elas se complementam. A import√¢ncia de cada uma no cen√°rio atual das empresas voltadas para tecnologia. Exemplos de sucesso de organiza√ß√µes que implementaram essas pr√°ticas com efici√™ncia. P√∫blico-alvo: Esta palestra √© ideal para profissionais de tecnologia, cientistas de dados, desenvolvedores, gerentes de produto, e todos aqueles que desejam compreender melhor como as organiza√ß√µes podem alavancar suas opera√ß√µes de dados e software.
bio:
Com mais de duas d√©cadas em tecnologia, minha jornada me levou de desenvolvedor a um especialista em Big Data, Machine Learning e IA. Atuei liderando e arquitetando plataformas de dados em grandes empresas como o C6 Bank, GFT Technologies, Cogna Educa√ß√£o, Falconi entre outras.

Essa dualidade me permite ter uma vis√£o √∫nica sobre o futuro da profiss√£o: como as tecnologias emergentes, como os LLMs, est√£o moldando o mercado e quais habilidades os novos profissionais precisam desenvolver para se destacarem.

name: Felipe de Freitas Campos
title: Microservi√ßos serverless: diferentes designs, mesmas dores
abstract: A ado√ß√£o de microservi√ßos serverless promete maior agilidade e escalabilidade, mas, apesar das diferentes abordagens de design, as equipes enfrentam desafios semelhantes. Quest√µes como observabilidade, lat√™ncia, custos imprevis√≠veis e complexidade de integra√ß√£o continuam sendo pontos cr√≠ticos. Este trabalho discute como arquiteturas distintas convergem para os mesmos problemas e o que pode ser feito para mitig√°-los.
bio: Desde 2006 mergulhado em tecnologia, onde comecei no PHP, passando por outras linguagens, e hoje com bastante Python! Tamb√©m falo a l√≠ngua dos bancos de dados (SQL e NoSQL) e, desde 2012, flutuo feliz nas nuvens, com destaque especial para a AWS, onde sou Community Builder e l√≠der do AWS User Group Campinas‚Ä¶mas tamb√©m navegando por Azure, GCP, IBM e Oracle, seja com IaaS, PaaS, Serverless, IaC ou at√© com meu grande amor, o FinOps. Hoje estou focado em IA e como ela pode revolucionar nosso jeito de criar e inovar! √â isso ai‚Ä¶no fim, sou movido a #Curiosidade, #Desafios, #Comunidade, #Tecnologia, #Pok√©mon e #Caf√©!

name: Emerson Silva

abstract: Nesta palestra, vamos explorar como aplicar AIOps no dia a dia da opera√ß√£o de clusters Kubernetes utilizando o K8sGPT. Mostrarei como SREs podem transformar ru√≠do em insight, utilizando IA para interpretar sinais e sugerir corre√ß√µes automaticamente.
bio:
Sou desenvolvedor de infraestrutura e monitoramento, apaixonado por Open Source, comunidades de tecnologia e por compartilhar conhecimento. Tenho mais de 9 anos de experi√™ncia atuando em ambientes amplos e altamente cr√≠ticos, com foco em automa√ß√£o, confiabilidade e efici√™ncia operacional.
